alert.note: Alert for Athens; Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Meigs, Washington, south central Morgan, southeastern Athens, north central Wirt and Wood Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Washington, or near Coolville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, Beverly, Coolville, Chesterhill, Vienna, Williamstown, Washington, Mineralwells, Tuppers Plains, Lubeck, Boaz, North Hills, Lowell, Stockport, Lower Salem, Little Hocking, Fleming and Davisville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 165 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 11. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
